Outside the scope of your demonstration, but interesting variables in this experiment: 1. the rigidity of the sealed container will affect the flow outcomes (glass bottle versus silicone bag). 2. the size of the outlet, or added heat and/or surfactants can allow air to bypass the surface tension of the water and enter through the outlet.

Im literally in the exact same boat man. 28 and going back to school. I started relearning algebra and trig with this guy in the summer and am in school now learning calculus.  Trust me man take the time to really master algebra and trig before going to calculus. Derivatives and limits on their own are not difficult, it is the lack of algebra and trig skills that trip people up. It pays dividends well to get the hang of that stuff first . Good luck!!
